question: Which of the following investigation work on the same principle?
exp: Principle of: CT: Linear attenuation of. Xrays Xray: Xrays (Fluoroscopy also works on the principal of Xrays) MRI: Gyromagnetic propey of H+ USG: Pulse-Echo Principle with Piezoelectric effect PET scan: Annihilation and coincidence imagine, gamma rays -511 key HIDA Scan: Radioisotope scintigraphy, gamma rays.

question: Investigation of choice for GERD:
exp: Ambulatory esophageal pH testing using a catheter method or a wireless capsule endoscopically attached to the esophageal wall is considered for drug-refractory symptoms and atypical symptoms like unexplained chest pain. High-resolution esophageal manometry is ordered when surgical treatment of GERD is considered. Manometry is for motility disorders. HIDA scan, also called cholescintigraphy or hepatobiliary scintigraphy, is an imaging test used to view the liver, gallbladder, bile ducts, and small intestine. USG is used to view layers of the internal organs- GB, fluids, congenital hyperophic pyloric stenosis.
